alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Cumberland; Monroe; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 10:34PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton, southeastern Monroe, southwestern Russell and Cumberland Counties through 1000 PM CST... At 934 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tompkinsville, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burkesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
